intro: Ruellia strepens var. micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered ruellia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of blue or purple. Its flowers are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often used in ornamental gardening for its vibrant blooms.
